Reviews.Title: “Very nice, spacious apartments well located”
Reviews.Author: pschwaeb
Reviews.Content: The Aparthotel Napols is located in a quiet residential area near the Arc de Trionf Metro station. It’s not a far walk to El Born, Sagrada Familia and the Waterfront area. Also 2 short stops to Placa de Catalunya. There are 2 food markets on the block and a Patisserie across the street. It’s 2 blocks to Estacio del Nord to get a Taxi We had a 2 bedroom apartment for me, my wife and adult daughter visiting our son at Residencia Onix which was 2 blocks away. The apartment was clean, well furnished and very comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There was a full kitchen, dining room, living room and terrace. Great for families, or anyone who doesn’t wanted to be crowded into a hotel room

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Apartment”
Reviews.Author: DidiDuck
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in this apartment during August 2011. It was in a part of Barcelona that I lived in when I was 21, so the setting was already quite good to me. The livingroom was clean and decorated in an easy, minimalistic setting. The bedroom had two beds and I slept well during my stay. I loved the bathroom too: really suitable for girly girls that want to prepare for a lovely evening in a perfect city for evening-time. I don't think I can add a specific rave about this apartment that has been said before, but I liked the constant guard of the people downstairs, without being intruding on your private life. I would definately return to this particular place. I have stayed in another apartment in Barcelona before, that was quite good too, but I specifically loved the fact it was quite close (traveltime) to the citycentre and the setting around the apartment was charming, cultural and interesting enough to stay around too

Reviews.Title: “very happy christmas stay”
Reviews.Author: hihiromi
Reviews.Content: booked a room for 7nights christmas time. their booking site somehow booked us a room in the other location in barcelona but one e-mail to the booking manager fixed everything. no hussle at all. our triple apartment was very clean with 2 bedrooms,big kitchen, living/dining room and a bathroom with everything you need. they even come and clean,wash dishes and change towels everyday. our room(E4) was a bit noisy sometimes possibly with water pipe? other room toilet or shower noise? but not that you cant sleep or anything - we were very tired each day after so many things to do and see. but i can see some people might have problem with it. friendly staffs - all very helpful and kind with good english. location was also good, close to 2 metro lines. easy to find the place if you have any kind of map - a bit difficult first time if you havent got a map. we had a really nice christmas holiday in barcelona staying at the aparthotel napols. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Wished we could stay longer”
Reviews.Author: s e
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were only in Barcelona for a couple days, so didn't really need a full service apartment. But this property was less expensive than the hotels we reviewed. Our apartment was clean, very spacious -- which was really nice after a lot of tiny hotel rooms with even tinier bathrooms -- and had a lovely "local" view of other dwellings which made us feel like we were really living there. The front desk staff were wonderful to us, warm and professional. It was an inexpensive cab fare to/fro Barcelona Sants train station and an easy walk to a lot of sights. (Bus service was a bit trickier for us to get a handle of, but a metro station is closeby the hotel.) The kitchen was fully stocked with wares for cooking and serving. Next time, we'll stay longer and really settle in!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- Easy Access to Various Areas”
Reviews.Author: MKTJuly2010
Reviews.Content: We were slightly concerned about the location of this hotel to various historical sights, but once we arrived, we were proven wrong. We were walking distance to many places -- Arc de Triomf, Sagrada Familia, Placa Catalunya, La Rambla, Barri Gotic,vPicasso Museum and the Harbor. Granted, it took 15-20 minutes to walk to some of these places, but the walk was beautiful. We walked through different neighborhoods which gave us a better feel for what Barcelona is really like. It was also close to a metro station which was great. As for the hotel, you get what you pay for. The staff was very nice and the rooms were fine -- good enough to get the job done. My bed was sloped and the towels weren't always clean, but that was all surpassed by the fact that we were in a great neighborhood, not too far from the hustle and bustle, but far enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tons of room!”
Reviews.Author: mtbBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this apartment-hotel for four days while exploring Barcelona: we hardly had to take public transportation since everything we wanted to see from the beaches of Barceloneta to the museums on Montjuic were in reach (assuming you like to walk). As it happened we didn't really need all the space--two bedrooms, dining room, kitchen, and living room--since we spent little time in the hotel and ate out but if you are a family looking for convenient location and the possibility of eating some meals "at home" this is a good deal for the price. It would have been nice if the bathroom provided more towels and better quality toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a family!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for eleven days in August 2011 with two teenagers and had an excellent time. Convenient walking location to everything, loved the bakery across the street for our daily coffee and had a choice of two supermarkets on the same block. Staff was very helpful -- we also had a leak in the bathroom (it must have been the same apartment as the previous poster) but they fixed it right away. Large rooms, very nice balcony, so helpful to have a full kitchen. A great value compared to having to pay for two rooms at a hotel. We would definitely return and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “better than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: saluki1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aparthotel Napols with my husband, 16 month old son and sister-in-law in a two bedroom apartment. The rooms were extremely spacious and we enjoyed it immensely. The apartments are well appointed and seem more business standard than recreational. It was a great choice and well worth the 125 euros per night. The staff were friendly (if not a bit relaxed. But, the rooms were clean and I felt comfortable in the hotel. It is true that the walls are paper thin, but I did not find that a problem. The staff also put a baby cot in the room for my son. As far as the neighborhood it is a very nice location. ..though slightly removed. On the next visit I might stay somewhere a bit closer to the beach. But, all in all it is a good value for money. The only negative was a leak in the bathroom, which the staff never fixed. Instead they eventually changed our apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment for a group more than 2”
Reviews.Author: dewailang
Reviews.Content: Our party (5, including 2 young girls) stayed for 4 nights. Great apartment, with nice in-room amenities. The location can be a bit difficult when travelling with small kids/stroller: a bit of a walk from the subway station. Many times, when we wanted to talk with the front desk, staff, he was occupied with other things: phone, chatting with other guest, taking care of the car park customers, etc. Despite that he was quite kind. Note that it's not a hotel, it's simple an apartment with cleaning service once a day. Very nice location with the bakery and groceries just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but clean”
Reviews.Author: arctickoala
Reviews.Content: This was a very simple, but very clean place. Staff is well intentioned however a bit relaxed about everything. Although I have informed them our late checkin in when I arrived there was no one in the reception for 30 minutes and I was about to book and pay for another hotel that someone showed up. Expect very relaxed and casual ( but friendly) service. Clean room, really good location ( close by to everything, 15 minute walk) and quite surrounding. Have some pastries from the bakery right opposite of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarioXP
Reviews.Content: This is two bedroom apartment, with lining room and balcony, very spacey, clean, in good resident area near center of town and near of metro station. They don't have restaurant because this is apartment with full equipment kitchen. Stuff do cleaning room and change towels also they wash dishes in washing machine.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL/APARTMENT”
Reviews.Author: Eternaltravel12
Reviews.Content: Please do yourself a favour and do not go here. I had read a number of reviews of the hotel losing reservations but just thought hey, that won't happen to me. Well, it did. Despite taking an over 200 euro deposit and three confirmation emails they lost our 5 day reservation and sent us out on the street. They were rude and unapologetic. After ruining our vacation and then finally realizing they did take a huge deposit from us, they offered us a discount to stay there again!! Please do not stay here, many MANY other more professional places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Janoskolos
Reviews.Content: I had planned to spend 3 weeks in Barcelona, by myself. I had never been there. The hotel's location is great. Close to the touristic parts of the city (between 15 and 30 minutes walks). The apartment (4.6) I had was great, comfortable, and cleaned everyday. Very small kitchen but one can manage. All the food stores you might need are not even a minute from the hotel. Only problem I found was the noise from other apartments sometimes, and the unpleasant sounds through the ceiling of the furniture being moved for cleaning (it would be easily avoided if some felt pads were placed under...I meant to mention that to the staff but forgot!!!). I found the staff charming, helpful. Without any hesitation, I would go back to the same place whenever I would be in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if you know Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: docframe
Reviews.Content: Not far from Arc de Triumph and el Born. Perhaps more suited to those who know Barcelona well. Close to Picasso Museum and really not that far from Plaza Catalunya and Ramblas. Considered location near the Plaza Tethuan and 5-10 minutes from el Born for those tired of full frontal Ramblas experience. Quiet residential and safe area. Aparthotel excellent value, particularly for families and welcome 24 h doorman and carparking. Supermarkets and fab bakery/deli opposite. make this a good self catering choice. You would be hard pressed to find anything better at the price.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: chanoaji
Reviews.Content: The good: Clean small appartments. Good location, minutes to walk to the Arc de Triumf metro station. Safe area at night. It's a decent alternative to hotels if you're in Barcelona for a conference and everything else is overpriced. (this place is heavily overpriced too.) You can have breakfast in the excellent café across the street. Most of the personnel is nice, friendly, helpful. Bathroom is OK, water pressure is good. Beds are basic. Air conditioning is great. There are shops nearby where you can buy decent toiletries, if you want. The bad: hot water became icecold at 7:30 in the morning. (I was in the shower) I paid for internet at check-in, but no internet on my floor. (there was internet on floors 2, 3, 4, and in the lift, which was great. Good free wifi also on the sidewalk in front of the hotel.). Unpolite, grumpy night receptionist. Pretended not to understand "no internet", as his English was not so good. "no internet" understood and acknowledged by the rest of the staff (the polite guys), but nothing has been done to solve the problem. No apologies, no refund, no internet, 4 days. So: There are so many hotels in Barcelona, try to stay somewhere else. Or stay at the Napols if you have no choice. It's a clean place and the location is ok. Taxi drivers have no idea about its location, so give them the full postal address. It can also help to say Napoles (in Spanish) instead of Naples (in Catalan), or specify "estacion Norte" which is a bus station nearby, as I had a longer discussion with one driver about this . Bon voyage, Barcelona is a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed all the space”
Reviews.Author: Nonna-Papa
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Aparthotel Napols was as a result of looking for accommodations that would give us more space than an average hotel room, have more reasonable rates, be located away from the main tourist areas, and provide us with a kitchen in the event we chose to use those facilities. We found the hotel to be all that we required. Our two bedroom apartment was spacious, immaculate and looked exactly like the apartment depicted online, and to our delight, included a balcony. We used the second bedroom to store our suitcases. We stayed for four nights pre-cruise, and friends of ours joined us, in their own apartment, for the last two nights. The front desk staff was accommodating and polite upon check in, including showing us how to adjust the air conditioning when we asked. When they came to know us, they became very personable and of great help to us in our first visit to Barcelona. The housekeeping staff was quick, efficient and despite our language barriers, were happy to provide me with a sponge and cloth for the kitchen. I must admit the apartment's first impression was of a somewhat stark space. Some art on the walls would greatly warm up the rooms. But aside from that, I would not hesitate to recomment this hotel or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good on the whole”
Reviews.Author: TripAdviserreader
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 of us stayed here for a hen weekend at the end of Sep. We had booked 3 apartments through a company specialising in hen weekends, but on arrival the check-in process was a shambles. A very rude man who spoke very little english took ages to establish that we were indeed booked in, and to allocate our apartments. My group of 3 girls were allocated a key for an apartment which was occupied! We opened the door and saw their belongings and valuables! NOT good from a security point of view. Once established in the correct apartments we found them to be clean, modern and spacious. We tended to get a cab to most places as it was a little too far to walk, especially at night. Have been back to Barcelona since, and chose as more central location near to the Ramblas, which I preferred.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: spinderella75
Reviews.Content: We chose this apart hotel based on a "family friendly" fellow tripadvisor review. We had an excellent stay here for a long weekend. 24 hour desk meant our arrival late on a Friday evening wasn't a problem. We'd booked the triple room which meant our 3 year old and 1 year old shared a single room with an additional cot provided. There is a fantastic bakery across the street which we visited often and 2 mini markets in the same street to stock up for self catering purposes. Microwave and dishwasher proved useful but nothing is provided in terms of cleaning products like dishwashing liquid or cloths. We tended to walk most places including to the Zoo (Dolphin show on at 1.30pm on Saturdays) and the Sagrada Familia but it was only a couple of blocks to the Metro and Bus station as well as being really easy to flag down cabs. The only two negatives mentioned in the review we'd read about already so at least we were forewarned i.e. no street noise as such but you can definitely hear the comings, goings and chair scrapings of your immediate neighbours and the glass coffee tables which weren't so family friendly with a sofa surfing toddler in tow so we hid them in the wardrobes! Plenty of space for the kids to crawl and run around in including a large balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean aparthotel close to Estacio Nord bus station”
Reviews.Author: wwlowe
Reviews.Content: This aparthotel is located about 2 blocks away from Estacio Nord bus station which is convenient for buses going to Girona airport. It is also close to two metro stops: Arc de Triomf on the red line and Tetuan on the purple line. A 20 minute walk will bring you to the edge of La Ribera district with lots of restaurants. Our two-bedroom apartment was spacious and clean. The kitchen is stocked with eating utensils, plates, pots, burners, microwave should you want to cook. There are a couple of supermarkets on the same street. The bathroom was also very clean. Beds were comfortable, showers were strong. There is maid service every day. The only complaint is that the soundproofing is bad and if you have loud neighbors, you will hear them. We could hear the woman upstairs walking in high heels, babies crying, a neighbor yelling. But overall it was a good value and we would probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, clean, spacious apartment”
Reviews.Author: merlot94
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aparthotel Napols for three nights, and were very pleased with the accomodations. The apartment (room 4.1) was spacious and very clean -- one bedroom with two twin beds, another with king bed, and large dining/living area, and a nice kitchen with up to date appliances (including dishwasher). We booked the first two nights through travel-agent friend (hotusa.com) of a friend, but then extended to a third night for which we paid 144 Euros for four people (20% discount for August) directly with the hotel. We had no problem extending our stay an additional night. From the looks of it, they're weren't many occupants while we were there. The hotel has onsite parking (15 Euros/night), but street parking is free during August, and we were able to park a couple blocks away. The location is very convenient to major attractions (12 min walk to La Sagrada Familia, 20 mins to La Rambla, etc.), and grocery/bakery/produce shops on the same block as hotel. Our only complaint was kitchen was not stocked with basic amenities like soap, towels, sponges, pot holders, etc.; and the coffeepot was only a single serve. Also, don't plan on big dinners, as the the stove is only two small burners. If you're looking for a spacious place, especially with children, we'd recommend Aparthotels Napols highly. One warning: keep your young children away from the glass coffee table, which broke during our stay, fortunately with no injuries. Aparthotels has some other locations in Barcelona. Contact info: www.napols.net, aparthotel@napols.net.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mamaleahEngland
Reviews.Content: Napols accomadation was great, The location was spot on, everything close at hand, excellent maid service, very clean. Never got disdurbed at night ,had a peaceful nights sleep. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: threesacrowd
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived home today after spending a week at the Napols Apartments. When my family and I arrived we were allocated an apartment that was already occupied as the guest had extended their stay. We were given a larger apartment at no extra cost without any trouble. The apartments are really very nice and are kept very clean. The towels and bins are changed every day and although you can wash your own dishes if you leave them in the dishwasher they will be ready for you by the time you get back courtesy of the cleaning staff. The door to the apartment is opened by a card and this card also operates the lights and also the safety deposit box in the room (at no extra cost). The only problem is there are no kettles in the apartments but there is a small pot to boil water for tea or coffee. The area around the apartments is very good having at least three supermarkets (two in the same block as the Napols) lots of different shops and plenty of cash machines. The bus station is minutes away in one direction and the main road in the other direction. There are lots of eating places in this area. There is a mini bar in the apartment and the fridge has various soft drinks and water in them. Paying for what you use is left to the honesty of the guest at check out time. All in all great apartments, nice staff and a really good district to stay in. We would return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: ehy2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aparthotel Napols for an entire week and were completely pleased and delighted with not only the accommodation, but the service as well. The suite was comfortable, clean, and well-appointed (very modern furniture), a nicely stocked kitchen (with stove, fridge, microwave, and utensils) and all for an amazing deal at 78.00 euros per night. My only complaint was that wireless internet service was not available, but there are many Starbucks in Barcelona, as well as an internet cafe within walking distance, so getting online wasn't a problem. Both my husband and I discovered that we ended up saving huge sums of money by eating breakfast in our suite, as well as having our siesta snack there, too. There are two well-stocked supermarkets in the immediate area, as well as a coffee shop, a pharmacy, and several cozy bars (mostly locals, not many tourists in these) for tapas and beer. In a word, you can find something to eat at almost anytime of day. We liked the location, with the hotel being very near to the Arc de Triomph, which offers museums, a zoo, and several nice gardens to stroll about in. Main shopping districts and key neighbourhoods are well within walking distance as well as the Metro and bus services.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a little apartment that was ok. We only stayed here 1 night and went to Sitges about 45 minutes away from Barcelona, which I highly recommend. It's a great place with a lovely beach. The staff was OK. It was pretty much average, no complaints but nothing to rave about either.

Reviews.Title: “Should be rated 5 star”
Reviews.Author: DMcD
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here in November '05 and were pleasantly surprised to find that although this apartment/hotel had a 3 star rating, it was worthy of a 5 star compared to numerous other "3 stars" we stayed in traveling thru France, Spain and Italy during the month of November. Extremely clean, well-maintained, secure, has modern kitchens and baths, a great deal for the money and was very spacious and modern (including u.g. parking for a fee and elevators). It is centrally located within walking distance of the the marina, La Familia, the Ramblas and Park Guell (Gaudi's park - a great place to see). Only bad thing was that although our internet reservations clearly showed we were booked for 4 persons, during check-out they charged us extra for the fourth person in our "triple" room -- they don't seem to honor their quotes -- figured this is another country doing business their way. Other than that, this was a terrific place and welcome respite from some rather tacky hotel experiences we had in other places on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: helmary
Reviews.Content: just a quick review for anyone travelling to barcelona for a couple of days that aparthotel napols is a great place to stay. there were four of us on our trip and we stayed here. It was a two bedroomed apartment that we stayed in. It was very spacious, clean, quiet and very well run. It cost us less than €480 for the four nights which worked out about €30 per night each which I think was great value for money. The only negative thing I would say is that it states that there is a hairdryer in the apartment but unfortunately there is not. It is between a 10 and 15 minute walk to placa de catlunya which is the main square in barcelona and next to the las ramblas.

HotelInfo.Name: Aparthotel Napols
HotelInfo.Address: Napols, 116, 08013 Barcelona, Spain
